SENT.plain: Bilateral infarctions of the thalamus account for only a small fraction of ischemic strokes and carry a poor prognosis
These infarcts rarely have a venous etiology
A case secondary to straight sinus thrombosis is presented
Difficulties in considering the diagnosis and its radiological appearances are discussed

A simple imaging pathway including computed tomographic angiography and magnetic resonance imaging including a susceptibility-weighted sequence is presented in order to facilitate determination of the exact etiology in order to optimize therapy accordingly
